title: What’s the difference between autonomous vehicles and driver-assistance tech?
content:
Your new car is packed with a bunch of driver-assist features. But that doesn’t exactly make it an autonomous vehicle. So what’s the difference? What is driver-assist? Driver-assist is also called Advanced Driving Assistance Systems (ADAS). It refers to, and encompasses functions and technology that augment the driving experience of the driver. These include:  Blindspot detection. Front, rear, and cross-traffic alerts. Collision avoidance. Lane departure warning. Forward and side collision warning. Adaptive cruise control. Park assist.
